text:
Ash clings to your boots like a second skin as you tread deeper. The wind here carries whispers—some mournful, some mocking. You pass rows of pyres long extinguished, each bearing the sigil of forgotten houses. The path narrows between jagged spires of obsidian glass, their surfaces cracked with ancient heat.

Two smells mingle in the air now: rot and something older, fainter... a promise broken. The landscape splits ahead. You sense danger in either direction, but one path beckons with the scent of decay, the other with the pull of unkindled flame.
lore: In the age before light, it was said that every ruin bore the mark of its last truth. Here in the Ashlands, those who walked deeper rarely returned—drawn toward roots of something far more ancient than the Flame.
